Title: Life Hacks: Communication
Book Description: 'Flame wars got you down? This panel will cover hacks for improving interpersonal communication.  Topics include: active listening- nonviolent communication- conflict resolution- consensus decision-making- validation- and common pitfalls and fallacies.'

Title: Civic Technology
Book Description: 'From SMS-based blogging platforms- to visualization of large-scale public data- to Android tablets for prison inmates reconnecting with society- the way we interact with each other- our communities- and our governments is changing.  This panel will present some exciting examples and speculate on future possibilities.'

Title: Advanced Napping: In Public, At Work, Even Instead of Sleep
Presenters: Marie Staver, Ed Platt, Neil Funk
Book Description: 'The science is pretty unanimous:  Naps help improve concentration- energy- mood- and may be linked to other health and lifestyle benefits too.  But how- in the real world- can you really get the naps you want?  Long-term polyphasic sleeper and author Marie Staver (aka PureDoxyk) will give tips and answer questions about napping in public- negotiating naptime at work- prioritizing naps- and teaching yourself to fall asleep quickly and wake rested. '

Title: Data Visualization with d3.js
Book Description: 'See examples of interactive data visualizations built with d3.js and learn how to make your own.'

Title: Open Source Jobs
Presenters: Ed Platt, Jorge Castro, Eric Merrill, Matt Switlik
Book Description: 'Love free and open source software?  Want to find a way to get paid to work on it?  Our panelists have found a way to do it- come find out how you can too!'
